activities.loc: MDB Check Monitor & Posted Calendar for Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Heather M Montano

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on November 7, 2022 at 11:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
10:23 AM Defendant Heather M Montano in court.  Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter appeared by Zoom video means. 
COVERS 22CF81, 22CF186, 22TR1119 & 22TR1120
PD has not found an Attorney yet for Defendant. 
Attorney Rockow relates and to check on Attorney for Defendant.
10:34 AM Attorney Rockow relates and asks for reset.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Office of State Public Defender Appointment of Counsel Report

10:59 AM Defendant Heather M Montano in court.  Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  This covers cases 22CF81, 22CF186, 22TR1119, & 22TR1120.

Counsel has not yet been appointed.  AIA set for 10/12/2022 at 10:00 AM.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Office of State Public Defender Appointment of Counsel Report

11:08 AM Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Heather M Montano in court. DE qualifies for PD. Counsel has not yet been appointed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report - No attorney appointed

11:04 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Heather M Montano in court. 
Court relates that Defendant qualifies for public defender, but counsel has not been appointed yet.  Defendant relates.  AIA set and reminder note given to Defendant in court.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Office of State Public Defender Appointment of Counsel Report

10:56 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Heather M Montano in court. Attorney Michael J Steuer appeared by video for Heather M Montano for today only.  Qualifies for public defender.  Reset for counsel to be appointed. Address and phone number confirmed.  Bond continues.  OWI citation date Defendant does not need to appear on.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473. 
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages. 
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold. 
Must not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.

1:37 PM Defendant Heather M Montano appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Andrew Knaak appears by video.  Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright  in court for the State of Wisconsin.  DE to contact PD office to determine eligibility.  If DE does not qualify, must complete dean form and file with Clerk of Courts Office.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
